title: Cranberry-Mint Marinated Cucumbers
ingredients: 4 cups cucumbers, peeled, scored, sliced into ¼ -inch rounds
2 tablespoons fresh mint leaves, finely chopped
instructions: Peel the cucumbers. Holding a fork with tines facing down, drag the tines down the length of the cucumber to score them before slicing.  Slice the scored cucumbers into 1/4-inch slices.  Toss sliced cucumbers with salt in a large mixing bowl. Place slices in a colander or sieve over a mixing bowl to drain for 1 hour.
Pour the juice into a small mixing bowl and add the balsamic vinegar and fresh mint.

After 1 hour, drain the cucumber slices and pat dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. Place in medium glass mixing bowl, add the red onion and pour the marinade over mixture. Toss to insure that the marinade wets all the cucumber slices. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or more to blend the flavors.
Remarks:  Will keep refrigerated for up to a week in a tightly sealed container.
Source:   From the school nurse at T. Roosevelt H.S., February 2001.
